channel.title: Rhyme Tyme w/ DJ Peter Parker
channel.description: "Rhyme Tyme" is the ultimate in hip hop radio. You can't ask for more. The combination of live guests performing and hot records being spun is the perfect balance. And you know the show motto, "More Rappin And Less Flappin". So unecessary talk and screaming over records is not happening.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Straight Hardcore Hip Hop...No Bullshittin
channel.itunes:author: DJ Peter Parker
channel.itunes:summary: "Rhyme Tyme" is the ultimate in hip hop radio. You can't ask for more. The combination of live guests performing and hot records being spun is the perfect balance. And you know the show motto, "More Rappin And Less Flappin". So unecessary talk and screaming over records is not happening.

item.title: Episode 11 (1/23/04) - The Killa Sha Hour
item.description: First off let me start by saying “R.I.P. Killa Sha”!!! I’m damn near speechless. This shit came out of nowhere. I was fortunate to work closely with Sha for many years. He was the epitome of hip hop. On the mic he was a beast and he more than held his weight on the turntables. On a personal note, Sha was one of the funniest cats I ever had the pleasure to be around. His wit and magnetic personality are clearly demonstrated in the 46 episodes of Rhyme Tyme we co-hosted together. In memory of Killa Sha I'd like to open up The Spider's Web vaults and present Episode #11 "The Killa Sha Hour". God bless the dead. 1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = Killa Sha 2) Show Intro 3) Nightshiftin = Killa Sha 4) Inner City = Killa Sha 5) Night Runs = Killa Sha 6) No One (Remix) = Killa Sha w/ Maxwell 7) Nourishment = Killa Sha 8) Hurt Niggas Freestyle = Killa Sha w/ Lloyd Banks and Prodigy 9) You Don't Know My Name (Remix) = Killa Sha w/ Alicia Keys 10) Mic Break #1 / interview = Killa Sha 11) Down And Out In New York City = Killa Sha 12) Is A Hook Really Needed = Killa Sha w/ Foul Monday and Jo Jo Pellegrino 13) Sneaky Uncle = Killa Sha 14) Turn Me Up Some (Remix) = Killa Sha w/ Busta Rhymes 15) Our Love = Killa Sha 16) Show Wrap Up

item.title: Episode 97 (6/29/07)
item.description: It's that time again. Time for the dopest hip hop radio show on the planet. This week we're taking a trip deep into the underground. This is where the real hip hop is at. None of that sing songy nursery rhyme bullshit here. Got brand new heat from J Dilla, Diamond D, Pharoahe Monch, Havoc (of Mobb Deep), and much more. Big ups to this weeks special guest K Banger who spit flames and nearly burnt down The Spider's Web Studios. Go cop his EP "Truth Be Told" on July 10. 1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) Show Intro 3) Say It = J Dilla ft. Ta’Raach and Exile 4) Blockshit = Marco Polo ft. Skyzoo 5) Born And Raised In The Ghetto = Point Blank 6) Respect = Sheek Louch 7) Thinkin A Lot = Pcasso 8) The Beginning Of The End = Supersoul ft. Shadow Huntaz, Akiladahun, O’Slick, and Infamous 9) Life = Diamond D w/ Large Professor 10) Mic Break #1 / Interview = K Banger 11) Without Soul = K Banger w/ John Robinson 12) All I Need = K Banger 13) Mic Break #2 / Freestyle = K Banger 14) Free = Pharoahe Monch 15) The Weeping Tiger = Cilvaringz w/ Raekwon 16) Be There = Havoc (of Mobb Deep) 17) Wallet = Krhyme Life (of T.M.F. / Theodore Unit) 18) Big Thangs = Buff 1 19) Show Wrap Up

item.title: Episode 61 (11/25/05) Replay
item.description: Time certainly flies while you're busting your ass. It's been almost a month since doing a new show. Good thing my side project is nearly finished then it's back to the regular weekly "Rhyme Tyme" routine. Be on the lookout for my newest CD "Diamond Is Forever" with none other than the legendary Diamond D. More details to come. For all my real hip hoppers I uploaded an old show I did back in November 2005 consisting of some of the hottest live performances from "Rhyme Tyme". There are some sick freestyles on here from the early days of the show never before podcasted so enjoy. 1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) Show Intro 3) Masta Ace Freestyle 4) Drag On Freestyle 5) Neek The Exotic and Royal Flush Freestyle 6) Casual Freestyle 7) Da Ranjahz Freestyle 8) O.C. Freestyle 9) Grafh Freestyle 10) Bathgate Freestyle 11) Scram Jones Freestyle 12) Nature Freestyle 13) Fort Nox Freestyle 14) Synp Life (of D Block) Freestyle 15) Timbo King, Killah Priest, and Hell Raiza Freestyle 16) Show Wrap Up

item.title: Episode 96 (5/18/07)
item.description: Lookin at my gucci it's about that time. Time for another classic episode of the realest hip hop radio show out there, "Rhyme Tyme" with DJ Peter Parker. This week there's so much heat being played it's ridiculous. Can someone tell me why this show isn't syndicated on Sirius or XM? Not only have we got the world premier of Diamond D's new joint with Large Professor, we've got hot new exclusives from Show and AG, Common, Jay Dee, Raekwon, Trife Da God, Styles with AZ, and many many more. As always there's a special guest up in "The Web" too. Ras Beats is on the wheels of steel for the second half of the show providing turntable treats for your enjoyment. So now you got two hip hop veterans in the house. Speaking of which, peep the picture of DJ Peter Parker learning how to scratch from his father pretty much before he could walk. Now that's real hip hop!!! 1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) Show Intro 3) Lay It Down = Marco Polo ft. Roc Marciano 4) Life = Diamond D w/ Large Professor 5) Business As Usual = Show and AG 6) The Game = Common 7) Diamonds = Jay Dee 8) The World Is A Ghetto = Trife Da God 9) The Hardest = Styles w/ AZ 10) En Why Cee (N.Y.C.) = Juganot w/ Joell Ortiz and Uncle Murder 11) Fly Poetry = Raekwon 12) Hip Hop Is Outta Control = Ankh Amen Ra 13) Home Of The Greats = Black Milk 14) The Purist = Poly Rhythm Addicts w/ Large Professor 15) The Radar = Marco Polo ft. Large Professor 16) Hip Hop Lives = KRS One and Marley Marl 17) Down In New York City = Evidence 18) More Than Music = John Robinson 19) Show Wrap Up

item.title: Episode 95 (4/27/07) - The Ic-A-Don Invasion
item.description: Welcome back. You are now tuned in to the Ic-A-Don invasion of Rhyme Tyme!!! All Ic for a whole hour. Hear songs spanning his career from his first appearance on wax, courtesy of Redman's "Malpratice" album, to joints literally right out of the studio. If that's not enough during the live freestyle segment Ic spits the very rhymes that blew Redman's mind and got him signed some 6 years ago. Whether you know him as Icarus or his new name Ic-A-Don, there's no denying this guy is one of the brightest future stars in hip hop. 1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) Show Intro 3) Real Niggaz = Redman w/ Scarface, Ic-A-don, Treach (of Naughty By Nature), and Mally G 4) What’s That Sound = Ic-A-don w/ Redman 5) You Gots To Chill Freestyle = Ic-A-don w/ Rockwilder 6) How You Want It = Ic-A-don w/ Stack A Dolla and Method Man 7) Mic Break #1 / Interview = Ic-A-don 8) Branson Branson (unreleased version) = Redman w/ Ic-A-don 9) Get Em = Redman w/ Saukrates and Ic-A-don 10) My Apologies = Ic-A-don 11) The City Is Mine Freestyle = Ic-A-don 12) Redlite District = Redman w/ Ic-A-don 13) Mic Break #2 / Freestyle = Ic-A-don 14) George Jet Son = Ic-A-don 15) Breathe Freestyle = Ic-A-don 16) I Don’t Give A Fuck = Ic-A-don w/ Nature 17) Big Boy Toyz = Ic-A-don 18) Show Wrap Up

item.title: Episode 94 (4/13/07)
item.description: Coming off a record breaking show last week courtesy of Doctor Dre, you know I had to reach into my bag of tricks once again. Joining me this week is resident deejay Ras Beats aka Rhyme Tyme Ras for his monthly turntable exhibition. The combination is ill. With Ras on the 1's and 2's cuttin up all the dope underground wax and myself on the 3's and 4's supplying those exclusives, you can't ask for more. So turn that volume up to 10, get your drink or smoke, and enjoy hip hop radio the way it should be. Don't forget to tell a friend to tell a friend. It's Rhyme Tyme!!! 1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) Show Intro 3) The Money (orig/madlib remix) = J Dilla 4) Reachin = Polyrhythm Addicts 5) Things You Do = Evidence 6) Straight Murder = Prodigy w/ 50 Cent 7) Body Bags = Game 8) Rock Me = Capital D (of All Natural) 9) You Call That Love = J-Ro (of Alkaholiks) w/ Chords 10) We Ain’t Runnin = Sheek Louch 11) The Movement = Jax (of Binkis) 12) War = Marco Polo ft Kardinal Offishall 13) Block Royal = Joel Ortiz 14) How Big Is Your World = Median 15) Jones In Ya Bones = Butta Verses w/ Lucien 16) Stick Em Up = Big City w/ Greg Nice 17) Show Wrap Up

item.title: Episode 93 (3/30/07)
item.description: This week we're taking a trip back in time to 1986 courtesy of Dr. Dre who at the time was in the World Class Wreckin Cru. This is from the historic Roadium Mixtape series which was sold exclusively at the L.A. swap meats. Entitled "86 In The Mix", Dr. Dre takes mixtapes to the next level incorporating multitrack recorders and other high end recording equipment. At times you can hear 3 or 4 records being mixed at the same time all while Dre is scratchin on top of em. He burns through literally 300 records or more so a tracklist is non existent. If anyone can compile a tracklist I will personally big them up as the "king of hip hop". Much props to Dr. Dre for creating such a masterpiece. If you didn't know now you know. This could be one of the illest mixtapes ever!!!

item.title: Episode 66 (1/1/06) "The Wu Years Show" Throwback
item.description: Just wanted to clarify that "Rhyme Tyme" is broadcasting new shows on a bi weekly basis until May/June. Contractual obligations have my hands tied and my time filled. Then it's back to the normal weekly routine. And I can't wait. This slowed down pace is driving me nuts. Since this is an off week I decided to hit you with one of the illest of all the Rhyme Tyme episodes. This is the infamous "Wu Years Show" that broadcasted New Year's Eve 2006. I dug deep in the crates and spun nothing but the illest and rarest Wu-Tang records I could find. Also this is the historic first appearance where Trife Da God, Kryme Life, and Tommy Whispers air it out for nearly 15 minutes over the "Murdergram" Instrumental. Did someone say hip hop is dead? Certainly isn't in The Spider's Web. It stays poppin over here! Thanks for listening. 1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) Show Intro 3) Pass The Bone = Genius 4) Drug Free = Deadly Venoms w/ Ol Dirty Bastard 5) Cobra Clutch = Ghostface Killah 6) Set It Off Freestyle = Ghostface Killah & Trife Da God 7) Run (unreleased version) = Raekwon 8) Run = Cappadonna 9) Mic Break #1 / Interview = Trife Da God 10) Put It On The Line = Trife Da God 11) Fire = Ghostface Killah & Trife Da God 12) Mic Break #2 / Freestyle = Trife Da God, Kryme Life, & Tommy Whispers 13) Don’t U Know Pt. 2 = Ol Dirty Bastard 14) Mr. Sandman = Method Man w/ RZA, Inspectah Deck, Street Life, and Carlton Fisk 15) Fear, Love, And War = Killarmy 16) Labels (rza remix) = Genius 17) Show Wrap Up

item.title: Episode 92 (3/16/07)
item.description:
Things are heatin up over at The Spider's Web Studios. This week joinin me up in the lab is none other than Trife Da God. Most of y'all should already be familiar with his work with Ghostface and Theodore Unit but if you're not pay close attention. This guy is one of the most talented MC's out there, period. If you don't believe me just peep the 9 minute freestyle he kicked over some classic Wu-Tang/Mobb Deep instrumentals and see for yourself. If that's not enough, Trife brought tons of joints for me to touch. So roll up a fat one and put it in the air. It's the Trife takeover.
1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) Show Intro 3) Project Soap Operas = Ghostface Killah & Trife Da God w/ Kryme Life (of T.M.F.) 4) Beefin For Nothing = Trife Da God 5) Eighty Five Hip Hop = T.M.F. 6) Click Click Freestyle = Trife Da God 7) Mic Break #1 / Interview = Trife Da God 8) One Shot Deal = Pop Da Brown Hornet w/ Tommy Whispers & Trife Da God (of T.M.F.) 9) One Life To Live = Shyheim w/ P.R. Terrorist (of Killarmy) and Tommy Whispers & Trife Da God (of T.M.F.) 10) Mic Break #2 / Freestyle = Trife Da God 11) ‘88 Freestyle = Theodore Unit 12) The Game Don’t Change = Trife Da God 13) Dogs Of War = Ghostface Killah w/ Raekwon, Trife Da God, Sun God, and Cappadonna 14) Fire = Ghostface Killah & Trife Da God 15) Niggaz Wanna Get Me = Trife Da God & Kryme Life (of T.M.F.) 16) Theodore = Ghostface Killah w/ Trife Da God 17) Show Wrap Up

item.title: Episode 91 (3/2/07)
item.description: Welcome all my podcast heads. Things are taking off rather nicely on this end. First and formost I have to big up everyone subscribing. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. I have all kinds of incredible guests coming up for future shows so stay tuned. Next week I have none other than Trife Da God coming through. We gonna open the mics up for a live freestyle and jam nothing but Trife joints for the whole show. As far as this week, it's the first Friday of the month so you know what that means. Ras Beats on the 1's and 2's for the second half of the show. Now that's real hip hop. Hit me up with your comments and let me know how you're feeling the show 1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) Show Intro 3) N.V. = J. Dilla 4) Beefing For Nothing = Trife Da God 5) That Knock = Lagato Shine (of I.G.T.) 6) Ain’t No Halfsteppin Freestyle = Hell Razah 7) One Flow Rough (Large Professor Remix) = Styles 8) Rhymes With An L = M.E.D. 9) Street Conflict = Molemen ft. Hostyle and Cormega 10) Game Show = Eddie Brock 11) Million Dolla Deal (Remix) = Sadat X. 12) Solar Stance = J Biz 13) Blinded = Wisemen 14) Caked Up = Little Vic w/ Kool G Rap 15) Shut It Down = Black Milk w/ Ahk 16) Way To Go = Skyzoo 17) All I Know = DJ Jazzy Jeff ft. C.L. Smooth 18) Nasty = Phat Kat 19) Never Leave Part 2 = Maspyke 20) 914 = Pete Rock ft. Styles and Sheek Louch 21) Show Wrap Up

C.L. Smooth 18) Nasty = Phat Kat 19) Never Leave Part 2 = Maspyke 20) 914 = Pete Rock ft. Styles and Sheek Louch 21) Show Wrap Up

item.title: Episode 90 (2/17/07)
item.description: What's good party people. i gotta tell you how much I'm lovin this podcast technology. Shit is amazing. Big up to everyone checkin out the show. I hope y'all are feelin it. This week I got something EXTRA special in store for you. I am proud to present the "Grandma Parker Birthday Extravaganza". Here to celebrate with us is none other than Scaramanga (aka Sir Menelik of Dr Octagon fame). My man kicked some serious rhymes during an impromptu 10 minute freestyle segment. If that's not enough we got into a very candid discussion regarding some very sensitive issues. Topics got touched that most artists avoid talking about completely. Let me just say this, names were named. Trust me you don't wanna miss this one. 1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) Show Intro 3) Cold Steel = Phat Kat w/ Elzhi (of Slum Village) 4) Make Em N.V. = J Dilla 5) Gangsta Boogie = Pete Rock feat. Slum Village 6) About Me = Black Milk 7) The Game Don’t Change = Trife Da God 8) Mic Break #1 / Interview = Scaramanga 9) Put It In A Rap = Scaramanga w/ Saigon 10) Special EFX = Scaramanga w/ Godfather Don 11) Mic Break #2 / Freestyle = Scaramanga 12) One Million Two Million = Mobb Deep 13) Use Mad Clips = Cormega w/ Styles 14) Go = Aasim 15) Show Wrap Up

1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) Show Intro 3) Cold Steel = Phat Kat w/ Elzhi (of Slum Village) 4) Make Em N.V. = J Dilla 5) Gangsta Boogie = Pete Rock feat. Slum Village 6) About Me = Black Milk 7) The Game Don’t Change = Trife Da God 8) Mic Break #1 / Interview = Scaramanga 9) Put It In A Rap = Scaramanga w/ Saigon 10) Special EFX = Scaramanga w/ Godfather Don 11) Mic Break #2 / Freestyle = Scaramanga 12) One Million Two Million = Mobb Deep 13) Use Mad Clips = Cormega w/ Styles 14) Go = Aasim 15) Show Wrap Up

item.title: Episode 89 (2/2/07)
item.description:
Peace everybody. I'd like to welcome you to the first episode of the "official" Rhyme Tyme podcast. I am your host, hip hop enthusiast, DJ Peter Parker. To get some of you up to speed here's the lowdown on the show. I have been doing it since October 2003, broadcasting live from The Spider's Web Studios in Queens, New York. The show is beamed to legendary DJ Marley Marl at The House Of Hits where it is then transmitted over the internet through his site, futureflavasonline.com To listen to that broadcast live tune in every Friday night 1am est.
If you're looking for dope, high quality hip hop programming then you've come to the right place. "Rhyme Tyme" prides itself on playing nothing but the hottest, rarest most exclusive hip hop. If that's not enough almost every week a reputable, TALENTED artist stops by to catch wreck. Trust me you don't want to miss a single episode so subscribe, not now but right now.
This week my special guest is super producer / dj Ras Beats. My man gave my turntables a serious workout for the second half of the show. Talk about nice cuts and smooth blends. That's what's up, Go cop his debut EP "Balance" available on wax only, for you real heads. Now what are you waiting for? Go bump this ep of "Rhyme Tyme"!
1) Rhyme Tyme Theme Song = P-Dap 2) “show intro” 3) Stuck On You = Prodigy 4) The Life = Kool G Rap 5) Yes Sir = O.C. w/ Sadat X 6) The Roosevelts = Ghostface Killah and Raekwon 7) Musical Murda = Hell Raza w/ Ras Kass 8) Pain = Pharoahe Monch 9) Veteran = Grand Daddy IU 10) Real Talk = Lord Finesse w/ Grand Puba 11) I Used To Love H.E.R. = Kayne West 12) One Degree Of Me (Audio Resume) = Matt Fingaz w/ Talib Kweli and Game 13) Basic = Rapper Pooh and L.E.G.A.C.Y. 14) You Know = Phil Tha Agony, Tash, and M.E. 15) Stop Feelin Yourself = Skyzoo and 9th Wonder 16) Sounds Of The Slums = Inspectah Deck w/ Masta Killa 17) 914 = Pete Rock ft. Styles and Sheek Louch 18) Return Of The Iron Man = Ghostface Killah 19) Just Rhyming With Krumb = Teflon w/ Krumb Snatcha 20) “show wrap up”
